alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 5:31AM EDT until July 29 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard. * WHEN...From early this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. The street at the mouth of Big Bottom Branch is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.8 feet this evening. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued by 10 AM this morning.
